<<<api>>>: javax.imageio.ImageIO
<<<code>>>: ImageIO.write(capture, "jpeg", new File(folder.toString()+"/"+filename+".jpg"), 100);
<<<explanation>>>: You can set the compression level by passing a second argument to the ImageIO.write method. The first argument is the format you want to save the image in (in this case, "jpeg"), and the second argument is an ImageWriteParam object that contains various parameters for the image, including the compression level. In this case, you can set the compression level to 100, which corresponds to a high compression level.
